Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2014 06:29PM just4mules wrote: Thank you everyone for your kind words of encouragement!  After multiple calls today I finally got to pick up my report- both biopsies were benign!!!  I have learned so much in this two weeks, especially that there are a lot of very kind people out there helping others through very scary times.  You made all of this not quite as scary as it could have been and I am forever grateful.  Many blessings to you all.
Posts.Title: Waiting to schedule biopsy just4mules Mimikay23

Posts.Content: just4mules wrote: I have never had children, smoked for 18 years (quit on 2/19/06), and have a rather high stress job, especially the last 2 years.  Had my annual mammogram on 1/17 and then got a call back on 1/22.  I had a bad feeling as soon as I saw the phone number on my cell phone, as they never call- they always send the "everything looks good" letter. They had scheduled a diagnostic mammogram for 1/31.  I was not going to wait that long, so called and got in on 1/23.  After the diagnostic, went directly to ultrasound.  After ultrasound I was told I needed an ultrasound guided vacuum assisted biopsy and my PCP office would call to schedule it.  I got nowhere trying to schedule it myself as they needed an order from my PCP.  So I scheduled an appointment with my PCP for my annual PAP for tomorrow since she had an opening.  Hopefully I can get more information from her during that appointment like what is my BIRADS score?  I have been kind of dull and depressed since this all happened.  I had myself convinced I would not even need the ultrasound as the stats say 10% get called back and only 8-10% of those have to go on from there for further testing. So now I am hanging on to the statistic that 80% of biopsy results are benign.  The mass being seen is new since last year, but I cannot feel anything, is that unusual?  Too many unknowns and as so many have said on this discussion board, the waiting is a form of torture all its own.  I feel 'stuck' like I can think of nothing else. I am not sure how I will function at work with this being so all-consuming in my thoughts.   I appreciate all the information on this site, all those who are willing to share their experiences help me feel not quite so alone. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting to schedule biopsy just4mules Mimikay23

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2014 03:37AM just4mules wrote: No results yet- I called late yesterday and they do not have the pathology report back yet.  Still waiting......
Posts.Title: Waiting to schedule biopsy just4mules Mimikay23

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2014 11:38AM just4mules wrote: Well I now have a biopsy scheduled.  My PCP office had scheduled it for next Monday, but I went right down to the imaging facility and was able to get in tomorrow.  My PCP said the report indicated there were 2 spots they want to biopsy in the left breast.  My BIRADS score was a 4.  She could not palpate the masses either so I guess I did not miss anything in my monthly self checks.  So 11:00 tomorrow is the biopsy and hopefully 2-3 days later will have the results.  I feel fortunate that I have been able to get squeezed in so quickly, especially when I read about others having to wait weeks for a biopsy.  Fingers and toes crossed and prayers being said! Thank you everyone for your kind words of encouragement.  I will post tomorrow what my experience is with the biopsy.
Posts.Title: Waiting to schedule biopsy just4mules Mimikay23

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2014 05:52PM just4mules wrote: Biopsy is done- now waiting again for results.  First spot was painless, but second one was not, it was in denser tissue.  Thanks to several of you giving the advice, I have copies of everything now.  The ultrasound report says: Asymmetric density, left breast There appears to be a 1.7 x 1.7x 0.4 cm hypoechoic mass at the 3:00, N2 position in the left breast.  At the 4:00 and 3:00 positions, there is a 0.4x0.4x0.3 cm hypoechoic mass.   There are dilated ducts in the retroareolar left breast. One of the mammogram reports states "there is heterogeneously dense fibroglandular tissue." So now I know I have dense breasts... The waiting game continues...
Posts.Title: Waiting to schedule biopsy just4mules Mimikay23

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2014 07:03PM just4mules wrote: Still waiting...I called, left a message then just went there.  Pcp office says they don't have the results yet so I went to the imaging center and they don't have them yet either.  Still at the pathology lab.  I really hope I don't have to wait over the weekend.  This is really hard to keep focused at work and home.
